summary:
Rush was a famous rock band from Toronto, Canada, formed in 1968. The main members were Geddy Lee (vocals, bass), Alex Lifeson (guitar), and Neil Peart (drums). They had many lineup changes early on but found success with their second album, *Fly by Night* (1975). Their fourth album, *2112* (1976), made them even more popular.

Rush's music changed over time, starting with hard rock, then moving to progressive rock and using synthesizers in the 1980s. They had many hit albums and won lots of awards. Rush is known for their skilled playing and unique lyrics. They stopped performing in 2015 after Neil Peart retired.
title: Rush (band)
